title: I'm a high school student. Is reading two books per week too much? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not at all. In fact, you do better than many of your friends who probably don't touch any books other than those assigned to them. You still have a nice balance going on with outdoor and social activities, so sit back and enjoy your paperbacks. I spent my schoolyears holing up in the library and my room to read all day, so I had less variety in my activity. Never regret those days even a second. However, do make sure you still have enough rest. Efficient sleep time vary from person to person. I used to sleep at 2 AM and wake up at 5.30 AM during high school. It was good enough for me but horrendous to my friend who loved his solid 8-hours per day. You know your body. It does not have to be very constricting. After a big sports day, for example, you can forgo reading a bit and rest for the day. Moderation is the key.

I wasted a lot of time in high school.  I went to a fancy prep school and had every second of my day planned -- I had to, everyone did.  Now that I'm out of there, even though I know it taught me a ton and I wouldn't be who I am today without it, I consider those years wasted.  Even though I learned tons and tons, I didn't learn what I wanted to learn -- and what I enjoyed.  I made the mistake of giving up what I loved to do -- in my case programming and math research.  Don't make the same mistake.  Once I was done wth my education I realized that school seemed way more important than it really was.  Do what you want -- what you enjoy -- particularly if it's valuable in and of itself.
